div.l: But doth his note ⁊and wᵗith þᵉ clerkes pleydeA 4068
Tyl þᵗat her corn was fayre ygrounde
And when þᵉ mele is sakked rounde
Þis Iohn goth oute ⁊and fyndeth his hors awey
And began to crie harrowe ⁊and weylawey
Oure hors is lost Aleyn for cⁱristes bones
Step vp þy fet come of man at ones
Allas oure wardeyn hath his palfray lorn4075
Þis Aleyn al forgat þᵉ mele ⁊and þᵉ corn
Al was out of his mynde his housbandrie
What wyche wey is he gon he can crie
Þᵉ wyf come lepynge out at a renne
She sayde allas he goth in to þᵉ venne4080
Wᵗith wylde mares as faste as he may go
Vnþonk come on his hed þᵗat tyed hym so
And he þᵗat bet sholde haue knyt þᵉ reyne
Allas qduod Iohn Aleyn for cⁱristes peyne
Ley doun þi swerd ⁊and I wyl myne also4085
I am als swyft god wot as is a roo
By godes hert he shal not skape vs boþe
Whi had not þᵘou put hym in þᵉ lath
Ill heyl Aleyn by god þᵘou is a fonne
Þis sely clerkes haue ful faste yronne4090
Toward þᵉ fenne boþe Aleyn ⁊and eke Iohn
And whenne þᵉ myller saw þᵗat þei were gon
He half a busshell of her flour hath take
And bad his wyf knede hit in a kake
He sayde I trowe þᵉ clerkes weren aferd
Ȝut can a myller make a clerkes berd
For all her art ȝut lat hem go þar wey4097
